; docformat = 'rst' ;+ ; FUNCTION: get_ph_per_s_cm2_nm ;- function get_ph_per_s_cm2_nm,time,raw_counts,binsize,area=area,verbose=verbose ; * counts/second/area : ; integrationTime -> convert to seconds from ms ; cr = counts / integrationTime [counts / sec / nm] (the per nm is from the sampling at the specific grating position) ; apArea = .01 [cm^2] (aperature area) ; photonspersecPerCm2PerNm = cr / apArea [photons/sec/cm^2/nm] if n_elements(verbose) ne 1 then verbose=0 if n_elements(area) ne 1 then area=get_corr_area() ; cm^2 if verbose then help,binsize cps=raw_counts_to_cps(raw_counts,time,binsize) photonspersecpercm2 = cps / area ; this is now counts/s/cm^2 in a 1nm bin ; The flux equivalent is ergs/s/cm2/A, we just need to multiply by J/photon ; to have Spectral irradiance in terms of, where J/s/cm^2/nm = W/cm^2/nm return,photonspersecpercm2 end
